author: rkeithhill
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
- Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6?view=powershell-6).
- Fill out the following repro template:

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
Update-Help -Force
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```none
That help is updated with no errors.
```

Actual behavior
---------------

```none
Update-Help : Failed to update Help for the module(s) 'Appx, NetworkTransition, SecureBoot, SmbWitness, TrustedPlatformModule, WindowsUpdateProvider' with UI culture(s) {en-US} : One or more errors occurred. (A task was canceled.)
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.1.0
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.1.0
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.17763
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: adityapatwardhan
comments.body:
@rkeithhill I could only reproduce the problem for `WindowsUpdateProvider`. 

Can you give me the output of the `Update-Help -Force -Verbose <modulename>` for the others?

comments.author: adityapatwardhan
comments.body: Does `Update-Help` for those modules also fail from `Windows PowerShell`?

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body: Well, all the **other** modules update for me now (when updating the individual modules).  Just tried with `update-module -force` and yeah. only `WindowsUpdateProvider` is failing atm.

comments.author: adityapatwardhan
comments.body: Glad to hear that. I am following up on the `WindowsUpdateProvider` module.

comments.author: houstdav000
comments.body: So far as I can tell, this still seems to be an issue, regardless of powershell version. I've had it happen in 5.1, 6.2.3, 7.0.0-preview.5, and every other version. Powershell 6.2.3 Gives that the WindowsUpdateProvider is receiving a 404 error, while the other modules state that "A Help URI cannot contain more than 10 redirections. Specify a valid Help URI"

comments.author: houstdav000
comments.body: Okay, for that 404, I just used WireShark, and it's trying to download the HelpInfo from `http://download.microsoft.com/download/D/4/B/D4BFF683-2CDD-4424-925F-16F07A04F44E/WindowsUpdateProvider_faed25e4-6939-439d-8c13-4778ac5ac8a7_HelpInfo.xml`

comments.author: sdwheeler
comments.body:
The ones owned by the PowerShell team have been fixed or are being tracked in other issues. For modules not owned by the PowerShell team, issues should be opened with the appropriate owners.

@iSazonov I think this issue can be closed.

title: Update-Help fails to update six built-in modules
